intro: Conyza quitoc, commonly known as the common horseweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its small yellow flowers appear in clusters and are followed by fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Conyza quitoc is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
